==== Cognitive remediation ====
Theoretical principles :

- Inherited from neurology, neuropsychology and CBT

- Closer to rehabilitation techniques

- Aims to improve functional disability linked to cognitive impairment

Practical methods :

- Training impaired cognitive processes

- Reinforcement of preserved processes (compensation for impaired cognitive processes)

Cognitive functions concerned :

- General

o Memory

o Caution

o Executive functions

- Specific to certain disorders (e.g. schizophrenia)

o Metacognition

o Social cognition

question.title: What is the primary goal of cognitive remediation?
question.description: What is the main objective of cognitive remediation?

option_a.title: To improve emotional regulation
option_a.description: One possible goal of cognitive remediation

option_b.title: To enhance social skills
option_b.description: Another possible goal of cognitive remediation

option_c.title: To improve functional disability linked to cognitive impairment

option_d.title: To reduce stress and anxiety
option_d.description: A common misconception about cognitive remediation

correct_option.title: C
